page.title: 19RELIGION IN CRUDEN BAY.
page.content: The times of church services are in ST James church 9.30 AM and Ellon at 11.15 AM and later Sunday afternoon at 6.oo AM at ST Drostan's (R.A.F. camp, Boddam). At the Scottish Revolution 1689 Episcopal-church ceased to be the established church of Scotland. But in Cruden-Bay the parish priest, Willan Dunbar continued to minister until he was removed by government soldiers as a leader of the failed Jacobite rising in 1715 the first church on the present site was built in 1765 by James Earl of Erroll who lived at Slains castle. Cruden Parish Church is the church of Scotland and the Old Parish Church is situated out of the village towards Hatton. There are services there every Sunday at 11.15 A.M.
